meanings.sent1: The magician befouls the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent2: She befouls her friends by pretending to be someone else online.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat befools the dog by hiding its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The clever fox befools the hunter by leading him in circles.
meanings.sent5: The con artist befools unsuspecting victims with his smooth talk.

meanings.definition: To make someone appear foolish or stupid
meanings.sent1: His silly behavior befouls his reputation at work.
meanings.sent2: The prank befouls him in front of his crush.
meanings.sent3: The comedian befools the audience with his hilarious jokes.
meanings.sent4: The mirror befools her with its distorted reflection.
meanings.sent5: The fake news befools many people into believing false information.
